name: Purdue
blurb: The win at Alabama is the best win in CBB this year so far.

name: Michigan State
blurb: MSU and Illinois are 2a and 2b. I give MSU the slight edge right now because I think they match up well with Illinois head-to-head.

name: Illinois
blurb: Andrej Stojakovic is a dude but the lack of consistent outside shooting is a huge concern moving forward.

name: Michigan
blurb: Nice job taking care of business on the road at TCU. Going to find out a lot about this team at the Players Era festival.

name: Wisconsin
blurb: Tough ask to beat BYU in a de facto road game. Still very high on this team.

name: Iowa
blurb: Bennet Stirtz is my darkhorse B10 POY if Braden Smith slips up.

name: Indiana
blurb: The win against Marquette is losing luster every day.

name: Washington
blurb: This team is looking solid and is still waiting on Desmond Claude to get fully healthy.

name: UCLA
blurb: Bit concerning that Mick Cronin had to bench four starters to send a message. This is the one of the oldest teams in the sport...

name: Northwestern
blurb: Chris Collins finally has a big man that can score in Arrinten Page. This team will struggle with consistency but they are going to be a tough out.

name: Nebraska
blurb: Pryce Sandfort has been a pleasant surprise.

name: Oregon
blurb: Another team we will find alot about at Players Era.

name: USC
blurb: Needed triple overtime and a miracle shot to beat Troy at home.

name: Ohio State
blurb: Looked very unimpressive in a close win over Notre Dame. Just not seeing the vision this year for this team.

name: Minnesota
blurb: Niko Medved needs time. See if you can ride Cade Tyson to a solid finish and maybe finally recruit some players from the state?

name: Maryland
blurb: Really scary injury for Pharell Payne but it appears he will return very soon. Positive news for a team that would be lost without him.

name: Penn State
blurb: Big fan of Kayden Mingo but that's about it.

name: Rutgers
blurb: After a brutal loss to Central Connectictut St., it's becoming increasingly clear that this team is going to lose more than 15 games in the conference season.
